text: Socks before or after trousers, but never socks before pants. That’s the rule. Makes a man look scary, like a chicken.
author: Mark

text: She is attractive, but brown rice and pop tarts, chamomile tea and economy vodka? That’s a car crash of a shopping basket
author: Mark

text: It’s fine. Luckily we’re all English so no-one’s going to ask any questions. Thank you, centuries of emotional repression!
author: Mark

text: I’m not marrying out of spite, I’m marrying out of fear. There’s a very big difference.
author: Mark

text: A new boiler. Surely the least enjoyable way to spend a thousand pounds. At least throwing the money out of the window you’d see the scrabbling mass, the hate-filled faces. I have spent a cool grand on acquiring the resumption of an equitable temperature.
author: Mark

text: I’m the Wolf of Wall Street. Look out, Boots! I’m going to buy 100 meal deals and eat them off a prossie in the nude.
author: Mark

text: I love the homeless, one of my own would be amazing. I could look after him… not like a tamagotchi… better
author: Jez

text: Crunchy Nut Cornflakes are just Frosties for w*nkers.
author: Jez

text: Justice is done. Not actual justice, but what I wanted to happen, which is basically the same thing.
author: Jez

text: Mark, if I can just get rid of the dog corpse, there’s a chance I still might get laid here.
author: Jez

text: People like Coldplay and voted for the Nazis, you can’t trust people, Jez.
author: Super Hans

text: Tell you what, that crack is really moreish.
author: Super Hans

text: You’re not just a man any more – you are a man with a van. You get a van, Jez, we could be men with ven.
author: Super Hans

text: You are paying for that snake to be dry-cleaned!
author: Super Hans

text: You realise that tinned food is just for crackheads and wars?
author: Jez
